reviews.review_msg: mid terms are so hard, shes asking questions that I have never seen on the textbook although its only mcq but the choices are so confusing af, she only use a few slides of ppt as her lecture and I dont think that helps yall have to spend some time and read the book  . I DONT  REALLY RECOMMEND TAKING THIS COURSE !! 3/10
Boring lectures and too much work

Natasha is a nice person, but her course is not the easiest. we had 4 tests for every 2 chapter, it consisted of 90 MCQ questions. The whole class's average every time was only 40%-50%. Level of her tests did not match to her lectures. There are lots of reading, memorizing. I would not recommend taking this course with her.

Powerpoints are irrelevant to the textbook. She teaches us extra things which is not included on the textbook orally while not putting it down in detail on her notes. Should we suppose to google it? Tests are relatively having high proportion of marks for those extra things.
In the class she just repeats the lecture note, and she never replies my email :)))) I gonna retake PSYC102 next semester lol

She is a good instructor who has great insight towards course material and very caring. There is a group presentation. Exams are all multiple choice questions. It's better to read your textbook carefully as there are many questions from textbook only. You need to know your textbook well.  If you make enough effort, you will get a great mark.

Uhhh...no, run the other way. Lectures straight out the textbook. Nothing interesting or particularly useful. If you read the textbook, you don't even have to go to her lectures. You'll just get bored anyway... Her TAs were...well, they were unjustifiably harsh and sticklers for detail.
unorganized, stubborn, self-concious, high self-esteem, but tries to act very helpful and friendly

definetly take this course with alder. she's highly disorganized with her lectures and ALWAYS posts grades up really late so that they render almost useless to help you for your next exam. she's also a tough prof too. on one of our exam questions, 38/39 people immediately lost 50% because she wasnt clear on what she expected
she's hard and disorganized. take the course with alder, he's so much better and more interesting. classes are actually fun to go to. his exams are fair too unlike hers.
Approachable and friendly. Knows her stuff and is enthusiatic about teaching. Exams were hard but fair.

it can be a dry course. she didnt make it easy, that's for sure. essay questions are tough, as usual 50% is about the average for the essay questions on exams. papers were a bit harder than psyc 100. the final actually has an essay question!!! unheard of apparently

not very friendly, very rude and criticizes people when they're trying to make their points. always finds faults instead of encouraging to speak out. She also favors some people over others. Not a fair maker either.
